chargeHist.descr: Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker

result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Charles J. Wolowicz Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**10/24/16 Probation extended for 1 Year**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 15CF98.

miscConds.notes:
plus 10% restitution surcharge. TBD within 90 days.
Restitution must be paid in full one month before probation ends.

No contact with Lt. D. other than pursuant to his duty as a police officer.
No contact with Bull Pen Bar.
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, establishment/place where alcohol primarily is served/sold.
Defendant is not to be in a vehicle transporting alcohol or have alcohol in residence.

Any conditions/programming per agent.
Restorative Justice if victim(s) agree and it is approved.

timeConds.notes: Stayed 60 days. Huber has been granted. 3 months are stayed pending succesful completion of probation.
